lesson.title: Consistency, Availability, and Partition Tolerance
lesson.summary: CAP theorem states that distributed systems can guarantee at most two of three properties: Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance.
lesson.real_world_example: Amazon DynamoDB chooses availability and partition tolerance over strong consistency for their shopping cart system
lesson.mermaid_diagram:
graph TD
    CAP[CAP Theorem]
    CAP --> C[Consistency]
    CAP --> A[Availability]
    CAP --> P[Partition Tolerance]
    C -.-> CA[CA: Traditional RDBMS]
    A -.-> AP[AP: DynamoDB, Cassandra]
    P -.-> CP[CP: MongoDB, Redis]
discussion_questions: In what scenarios would you prioritize consistency over availability?
How does eventual consistency work in practice?

quiz.question: According to CAP theorem, what is the maximum number of properties a distributed system can guarantee?
